nodes.description: It integrates multiple standards, such as HIPAA, ISO, and PCI, into a single, comprehensive framework to safeguard sensitive data

nodes.name: Privacy Practices
nodes.description: HITRUST CSF Category 13: Privacy Practices

nodes.name: Privacy Training and Awareness
nodes.description: Privacy Training and Awareness
To ensure all personnel understand privacy requirements
Privacy training and awareness programs shall be provided to all personnel involved in handling personal information.

nodes.name: Data Minimization and Purpose Limitation
nodes.description: Data Minimization and Purpose Limitation
To ensure only necessary personal information is collected and used
Organizations shall collect and use only the minimum personal information necessary for stated purposes.

nodes.name: Automated Decision Making
nodes.description: Automated Decision Making
To protect individuals from harmful automated decision making
Organizations shall implement controls to prevent or mitigate harms from automated decision-making processes.

nodes.name: Privacy Policy and Transparency
nodes.description: Privacy Policy and Transparency
To maintain transparent and accessible privacy policies
Privacy policies shall be clear, transparent, and easily accessible to individuals.

nodes.name: Data Breach Notification
nodes.description: Data Breach Notification
To ensure timely notification of personal information breaches
Organizations shall notify affected individuals and relevant authorities when personal information is breached.

nodes.name: Right to be Forgotten
nodes.description: Right to be Forgotten
To provide individuals with the ability to request deletion of their personal information
Organizations shall provide procedures for individuals to request deletion or erasure of their personal information.

nodes.name: Privacy by Design
nodes.description: Privacy by Design
To integrate privacy considerations into system and process design
Privacy shall be considered and integrated into the design of information systems and business processes.

nodes.name: Cross-Border Data Transfers
nodes.description: Cross-Border Data Transfers
To ensure compliance when transferring personal information across borders
Organizations shall ensure that personal information transferred across borders complies with applicable laws and regulations.

nodes.name: Sensitive Personal Information Protection
nodes.description: Sensitive Personal Information Protection
To provide heightened protection for sensitive personal information
Enhanced controls shall be applied to sensitive personal information such as health information, genetic data, or biometric information.

nodes.name: Privacy Monitoring and Enforcement
nodes.description: Privacy Monitoring and Enforcement
Systems, hardware, software, services, and data are managed throughout their life cycles
nodes.example: Integrate cybersecurity considerations throughout the life cycles of systems, hardware, software, and services

nodes.description: To ensure ongoing compliance with privacy requirements
Organizations shall monitor, audit and enforce compliance with privacy policies and applicable privacy requirements.

nodes.name: Disclosure to Third Parties
nodes.description: Disclosure to Third Parties
Strategic direction that describes appropriate risk response options is established and communicated
nodes.example: Specify criteria for accepting and avoiding cybersecurity risk for various classifications of data

nodes.description: To ensure appropriate handling of personal information by third parties
Organizations shall obtain appropriate assurances that third parties can and will protect personal information consistent with privacy policies.

nodes.name: De-identification of Personal Information
nodes.description: De-identification of Personal Information
To protect privacy when personal information is no longer needed
Organizations shall de-identify or aggregate personal information when the original information is no longer necessary.

nodes.name: Privacy Impact Assessment
nodes.description: Privacy Impact Assessment
To identify and assess privacy risks
Organizations shall conduct privacy impact assessments to identify and assess privacy risks.

nodes.name: Data Retention and Disposal
nodes.description: Data Retention and Disposal
To ensure personal information is retained and disposed of appropriately
Organizations shall retain personal information only for as long as necessary to fulfill the stated purposes or as required by law.

nodes.name: Privacy Notice
nodes.description: Privacy Notice
To provide individuals with transparent notice regarding privacy practices
Organizations shall provide notice about their policies and practices relating to the management of personal information.

nodes.name: Accountability
nodes.description: Accountability
Public updates on incident recovery are shared using approved methods and messaging
nodes.example: Follow the organization's breach notification procedures for recovering from a data breach incident

nodes.description: To demonstrate the organization is accountable for complying with measures which give effect to privacy principles
Organizations shall be accountable for complying with measures that give effect to the privacy principles stated above.

nodes.name: Individual Participation and Access
nodes.description: Individual Participation and Access
To provide individuals with access to their personal information and the ability to have it corrected or deleted
Organizations shall provide individuals with a simple and timely means to access, review and obtain a copy of their personal information.

nodes.name: Information Quality
nodes.description: Information Quality
To ensure that personal information is accurate, complete, current and relevant
Organizations shall ensure personal information is accurate, complete, current and relevant for the purposes for which it is to be used.

nodes.name: Collection Limitation
nodes.description: Collection Limitation
To ensure the amount of personal information collected is limited
The organization shall limit the collection of personal information to that which is directly relevant and necessary to accomplish the specified purpose(s).

nodes.name: Purpose Specification and Minimization
nodes.description: Purpose Specification and Minimization
To ensure personal information is collected, used, retained and disclosed only for specific, explicit and legitimate purposes
Personal information shall only be collected, used, retained and disclosed for specific, explicit and legitimate purposes.

nodes.name: Consent and Choice
nodes.description: Consent and Choice
To provide individuals with appropriate notice and choice regarding the collection, use, disclosure and retention of their personal information

Organizations shall provide individuals with clear, prominent, easily understandable, accessible and affordable mechanisms to provide their consent for the collection, use, disclosure and retention of their personal information.

nodes.name: Business Continuity Management
nodes.description: HITRUST CSF Category 12: Business Continuity Management

nodes.name: Testing, Maintaining and Re-assessing Business Continuity Plans
nodes.description: Testing, Maintaining and Re-assessing Business Continuity Plans
Recovery activities and progress in restoring operational capabilities are communicated to designated internal and external stakeholders
nodes.example: Securely share recovery information, including restoration progress, consistent with response plans and information sharing agreements

nodes.description: The recovery portion of the incident response plan is executed once initiated from the incident response process
nodes.example: Begin recovery procedures during or after incident response processes

nodes.description: Information is shared with designated internal and external stakeholders
nodes.example: Securely share information consistent with response plans and information sharing agreements

nodes.description: Incidents are escalated or elevated as needed
nodes.example: Track and validate the status of all ongoing incidents

nodes.description: The incident response plan is executed in coordination with relevant third parties once an incident is declared
nodes.example: Detection technologies automatically report confirmed incidents

nodes.description: Backups of data are created, protected, maintained, and tested
nodes.example: Continuously back up critical data in near-real-time, and back up other data frequently at agreed-upon schedules

nodes.description: Personnel are provided with awareness and training so that they possess the knowledge and skills to perform general tasks with cybersecurity risks in mind
nodes.example: Provide basic cybersecurity awareness and training to employees, contractors, partners, suppliers, and all other users of the organization's non-public resources

nodes.description: Incident response plans and other cybersecurity plans that affect operations are established, communicated, maintained, and improved
nodes.example: Establish contingency plans (e.g., incident response, business continuity, disaster recovery) for responding to and recovering from adverse events that can interfere with operations, expose confidential information, or otherwise endanger the organization's mission and viability

nodes.description: Improvements are identified from execution of operational processes, procedures, and activities
nodes.example: Conduct collaborative lessons learned sessions with suppliers

nodes.description: Improvements are identified from security tests and exercises, including those done in coordination with suppliers and relevant third parties
nodes.example: Identify improvements for future incident response activities based on findings from incident response assessments (e.g., tabletop exercises and simulations, tests, internal reviews, independent audits)

nodes.description: Changes and exceptions are managed, assessed for risk impact, recorded, and tracked
nodes.example: Implement and follow procedures for the formal documentation, review, testing, and approval of proposed changes and requested exceptions

nodes.description: To ensure that business continuity plans remain valid and effective
Business continuity plans shall be tested and updated regularly to ensure they are up to date and effective.

nodes.name: Business Continuity Planning Framework
nodes.description: Business Continuity Planning Framework
Mechanisms are implemented to achieve resilience requirements in normal and adverse situations
nodes.example: Avoid single points of failure in systems and infrastructure

nodes.description: To maintain a single framework of business continuity plans
A single framework of business continuity plans shall be maintained to ensure all plans are consistent.

nodes.name: Developing and Implementing Continuity Plans
nodes.description: Developing and Implementing Continuity Plans
Incidents are eradicated
nodes.example: Cybersecurity technologies and cybersecurity features of other technologies (e.g., operating systems, network infrastructure devices) automatically perform eradication actions

nodes.description: Incidents are categorized and prioritized
nodes.example: Further review and categorize incidents based on the type of incident (e.g., data breach, ransomware, DDoS, account compromise)

nodes.description: Networks and environments are protected from unauthorized logical access and usage
nodes.example: Logically segment organization networks and cloud-based platforms according to trust boundaries and platform types (e.g., IT, IoT, OT, mobile, guests), and permit required communications only between segments

nodes.description: Physical access to assets is managed, monitored, and enforced commensurate with risk
nodes.example: Use security guards, security cameras, locked entrances, alarm systems, and other physical controls to monitor facilities and restrict access

nodes.description: Outcomes, capabilities, and services that the organization depends on are understood and communicated
nodes.example: Create an inventory of the organization's dependencies on external resources (e.g., facilities, cloud-based hosting providers) and their relationships to organizational assets and business functions

nodes.description: Critical objectives, capabilities, and services that external stakeholders depend on or expect from the organization are understood and communicated
nodes.example: Establish criteria for determining the criticality of capabilities and services as viewed by internal and external stakeholders

nodes.description: To maintain or restore operations and ensure availability of information at the required level and in the required time scales
Plans shall be developed and implemented to maintain or restore operations and ensure availability of information.

nodes.name: Business Continuity and Risk Assessment
nodes.description: Business Continuity and Risk Assessment
The estimated impact and scope of adverse events are understood
nodes.example: Use SIEMs or other tools to estimate impact and scope, and review and refine the estimates

nodes.description: Threats, vulnerabilities, likelihoods, and impacts are used to understand inherent risk and inform risk response prioritization
nodes.example: Develop threat models to better understand risks to the data and identify appropriate risk responses

nodes.description: Potential impacts and likelihoods of threats exploiting vulnerabilities are identified and recorded
nodes.example: Business leaders and cybersecurity risk management practitioners work together to estimate the likelihood and impact of risk scenarios and record them in risk registers

nodes.description: Internal and external threats to the organization are identified and recorded
nodes.example: Use cyber threat intelligence to maintain awareness of the types of threat actors likely to target the organization and the TTPs they are likely to use

nodes.description: Assets are prioritized based on classification, criticality, resources, and impact on the mission
nodes.example: Define criteria for prioritizing each class of assets

nodes.description: The organizational mission is understood and informs cybersecurity risk management
nodes.example: Share the organization's mission (e.g., through vision and mission statements, marketing, and service strategies) to provide a basis for identifying risks that may impede that mission

nodes.description: To identify events that can cause interruptions to business processes
Events that can cause interruptions to business processes shall be identified, along with the probability and impact of such interruptions.

nodes.name: Including Information Security in the Business Continuity Process
nodes.description: Including Information Security in the Business Continuity Process
Incident reports are triaged and validated
nodes.example: Preliminarily review incident reports to confirm that they are cybersecurity-related and necessitate incident response activities

nodes.description: Cyber threat intelligence and other contextual information are integrated into the analysis
nodes.example: Securely provide cyber threat intelligence feeds to detection technologies, processes, and personnel

nodes.description: Information is correlated from multiple sources
nodes.example: Constantly transfer log data generated by other sources to a relatively small number of log servers

nodes.description: Potentially adverse events are analyzed to better understand associated activities
nodes.example: Use security information and event management (SIEM) or other tools to continuously monitor log events for known malicious and suspicious activity

nodes.description: To counteract interruptions to business activities and to protect critical business processes from effects of major failures
A managed process shall be developed and maintained for business continuity throughout the organization.

nodes.name: Information Security Incident Management
nodes.description: HITRUST CSF Category 11: Information Security Incident Management

nodes.name: Collection of Evidence
nodes.description: Collection of Evidence
Information on adverse events is provided to authorized staff and tools
nodes.example: Use cybersecurity software to generate alerts and provide them to the security operations center (SOC), incident responders, and incident response tools

nodes.description: Networks and network services are monitored to find potentially adverse events
nodes.example: Monitor DNS, BGP, and other network services for adverse events

nodes.description: Legal, regulatory, and contractual requirements regarding cybersecurity - including privacy and civil liberties obligations - are understood and managed
nodes.example: Determine a process to track and manage legal and regulatory requirements regarding protection of individuals' information (e.g., Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act, California Consumer Privacy Act, General Data Protection Regulation)

nodes.description: To ensure that evidence is collected in a manner that makes it acceptable in court
Where a follow-up action against a person or organization involves legal action, evidence shall be collected, retained and presented.

nodes.name: Learning from Information Security Incidents
nodes.description: Learning from Information Security Incidents
Configuration management practices are established and applied
nodes.example: Establish, test, deploy, and maintain hardened baselines that enforce the organization's cybersecurity policies and provide only essential capabilities (i.e., principle of least functionality)

nodes.description: The confidentiality, integrity, and availability of data-in-transit are protected
nodes.example: Use encryption, digital signatures, and cryptographic hashes to protect the confidentiality and integrity of network communications

nodes.description: Risk responses are chosen, prioritized, planned, tracked, and communicated
nodes.example: Apply the vulnerability management plan's criteria for deciding whether to accept, transfer, mitigate, or avoid risk

nodes.description: To reduce the likelihood or impact of future incidents
There shall be mechanisms in place to enable the types, volumes and costs of information security incidents to be quantified and monitored.

nodes.name: Responsibilities and Procedures
nodes.description: Responsibilities and Procedures
Incidents are contained
nodes.example: Cybersecurity technologies (e.g., antivirus software) and cybersecurity features of other technologies (e.g., operating systems, network infrastructure devices) automatically perform containment actions

nodes.description: Internal and external stakeholders are notified of incidents
nodes.example: Follow the organization's breach notification procedures after discovering a data breach incident, including notifying affected customers

nodes.description: Processes for receiving, analyzing, and responding to vulnerability disclosures are established
nodes.example: Conduct vulnerability information sharing between the organization and its suppliers following the rules and protocols defined in contracts

nodes.description: Relevant suppliers and other third parties are included in incident planning, response, and recovery activities
nodes.example: Define and use rules and protocols for reporting incident response and recovery activities and the status between the organization and its suppliers

nodes.description: To ensure a consistent and effective approach to the management of information security incidents
Management responsibilities and procedures shall be established to ensure a quick, effective and orderly response to information security incidents.

nodes.name: Reporting Security Weaknesses
nodes.description: Reporting Security Weaknesses
To ensure information security events and weaknesses are communicated in a manner allowing timely corrective action
All employees, contractors and third-party users of information systems and services shall be required to note and report any observed or suspected security weaknesses.

nodes.name: Reporting Information Security Events
nodes.description: Reporting Information Security Events
Incidents are declared when adverse events meet the defined incident criteria
nodes.example: Apply incident criteria to known and assumed characteristics of activity in order to determine whether an incident should be declared

nodes.description: Cybersecurity is included in human resources practices
nodes.example: Integrate cybersecurity risk management considerations into human resources processes (e.g., personnel screening, onboarding, change notification, offboarding)

nodes.description: To ensure information security events and weaknesses are communicated in a manner allowing timely corrective action
Information security events shall be reported through appropriate management channels as quickly as possible.

nodes.name: Information Systems Acquisition, Development and Maintenance
nodes.description: HITRUST CSF Category 10: Information Systems Acquisition, Development and Maintenance

nodes.name: Covert Channels and Trojan Code
nodes.description: Covert Channels and Trojan Code
Computing hardware and software, runtime environments, and their data are monitored to find potentially adverse events
nodes.example: Monitor email, web, file sharing, collaboration services, and other common attack vectors to detect malware, phishing, data leaks and exfiltration, and other adverse events

nodes.description: Software is maintained, replaced, and removed commensurate with risk
nodes.example: Perform routine and emergency patching within the timeframes specified in the vulnerability management plan

nodes.description: The authenticity and integrity of hardware and software are assessed prior to acquisition and use
nodes.example: Assess the authenticity and cybersecurity of critical technology products and services prior to acquisition and use

nodes.description: Vulnerabilities in assets are identified, validated, and recorded
nodes.example: Use vulnerability management technologies to identify unpatched and misconfigured software

nodes.description: To detect unauthorized activities
Organizations shall minimize the opportunities for insertion of covert channels or Trojan code into systems.

nodes.name: Restrictions on Changes to Software Packages
nodes.description: Restrictions on Changes to Software Packages
External service provider activities and services are monitored to find potentially adverse events
nodes.example: Monitor remote and onsite administration and maintenance activities that external providers perform on organizational systems

nodes.description: To minimize the risk of corruption of information systems
Modifications to software packages shall be discouraged and limited to necessary changes.

nodes.name: Technical Review of Operating System Changes
nodes.description: Technical Review of Operating System Changes
Personnel activity and technology usage are monitored to find potentially adverse events
nodes.example: Use behavior analytics software to detect anomalous user activity to mitigate insider threats

nodes.description: Representations of the organization's authorized network communication and internal and external network data flows are maintained
nodes.example: Maintain baselines of communication and data flows within the organization's wired and wireless networks

nodes.description: Requirements to address cybersecurity risks in supply chains are established, prioritized, and integrated into contracts and other types of agreements with suppliers and other relevant third parties
nodes.example: Establish security requirements for suppliers, products, and services commensurate with their criticality level and potential impact if compromised

nodes.description: To ensure that disruptions to business are minimized
When operating systems are changed, business-critical applications shall be reviewed and tested.

nodes.name: Change Control Procedures
nodes.description: Change Control Procedures
To minimize the corruption of information systems
The implementation of changes shall be controlled by the use of formal change control procedures.

nodes.name: Access Control to Program Source Code
nodes.description: Access Control to Program Source Code
To prevent unauthorized access to program source code
Access to program source code shall be restricted.

nodes.name: Protection of System Test Data
nodes.description: Protection of System Test Data
The physical environment is monitored to find potentially adverse events
nodes.example: Monitor logs from physical access control systems (e.g., badge readers) to find unusual access patterns (e.g., deviations from the norm) and failed access attempts

nodes.description: To ensure the protection of data used for testing
Test data shall be selected carefully, and protected and controlled.

nodes.name: Control of Operational Software
nodes.description: Control of Operational Software
To protect the integrity of operational systems
There shall be procedures in place to control the installation of software on operational systems.

nodes.name: Management of Encryption Keys
nodes.description: Management of Encryption Keys
To protect the confidentiality, authenticity or integrity of information
Key management shall be in place to support the organization's use of cryptographic techniques.

nodes.name: Encryption
nodes.description: Encryption
To protect the confidentiality of sensitive or critical information
Encryption shall be used to protect the confidentiality of sensitive information.

nodes.name: Policy on Use of Cryptographic Controls
nodes.description: Policy on Use of Cryptographic Controls
Users, services, and hardware are authenticated
nodes.example: Require multifactor authentication

nodes.description: To protect the confidentiality, authenticity or integrity of information
A policy on the use of cryptographic controls for protection of information shall be developed and implemented.

nodes.name: Protecting Application Services Transactions
nodes.description: Protecting Application Services Transactions
The confidentiality, integrity, and availability of data-at-rest are protected
nodes.example: Use encryption, digital signatures, and cryptographic hashes to protect the confidentiality and integrity of stored data in files, databases, virtual machine disk images, container images, and other resources

nodes.description: To prevent errors, loss, unauthorized modification or misuse of information in applications
Information involved in electronic transactions shall be appropriately secured.

nodes.name: Securing Application Services on Public Networks
nodes.description: Securing Application Services on Public Networks
To protect information involved in application services passing over public networks
Information involved in application services passing over public networks shall be protected from fraudulent activity, contract dispute and unauthorized disclosure and modification.

nodes.name: Security Requirements of Information Systems
nodes.description: Security Requirements of Information Systems
The organization's technology assets are protected from environmental threats
nodes.example: Protect organizational equipment from known environmental threats, such as flooding, fire, wind, and excessive heat and humidity

nodes.description: Secure software development practices are integrated, and their performance is monitored throughout the software development life cycle
nodes.example: Protect all components of organization-developed software from tampering and unauthorized access

nodes.description: To ensure that security is built into information systems
Security requirements shall be identified and agreed prior to the development and/or implementation of information systems.

nodes.name: Communications and Operations Management
nodes.description: HITRUST CSF Category 9: Communications and Operations Management

nodes.name: Secure Configuration Management
nodes.description: Secure Configuration Management
To maintain security of system configurations
Configurations of information systems shall be securely managed and controlled.

nodes.name: Monitoring Physical Access
nodes.description: Monitoring Physical Access
To detect unauthorized physical access to facilities
Physical access to information processing facilities shall be monitored and recorded.

nodes.name: Baseline Configuration and Standards
nodes.description: Baseline Configuration and Standards
Log records are generated and made available for continuous monitoring
nodes.example: Configure all operating systems, applications, and services (including cloud-based services) to generate log records

nodes.description: To maintain consistent security configurations across systems
Baseline configurations and standards shall be defined and implemented for all information systems.

nodes.name: Data Leakage Prevention
nodes.description: Data Leakage Prevention
To prevent unauthorized disclosure of sensitive information
Data leakage prevention controls shall be implemented to monitor and prevent unauthorized disclosure of sensitive information.

nodes.name: Destruction of Information
nodes.description: Destruction of Information
Roles, responsibilities, and authorities related to cybersecurity risk management are established, communicated, understood, and enforced
nodes.example: Document risk management roles and responsibilities in policy

nodes.description: To ensure secure destruction of confidential information
Information shall be securely destroyed when no longer required using approved techniques.

nodes.name: Information Retention and Archiving
nodes.description: Information Retention and Archiving
Access permissions, entitlements, and authorizations are defined in a policy, managed, enforced, and reviewed, and incorporate the principles of least privilege and separation of duties
nodes.example: Review logical and physical access privileges periodically and whenever someone changes roles or leaves the organization, and promptly rescind privileges that are no longer needed

nodes.description: Identities and credentials for authorized users, services, and hardware are managed by the organization
nodes.example: Initiate requests for new access or additional access for employees, contractors, and others, and track, review, and fulfill the requests, with permission from system or data owners when needed

nodes.description: To maintain information accessibility and compliance
Information shall be retained and archived in accordance with legal, regulatory and business requirements.

nodes.name: System Hardening
nodes.description: System Hardening
To reduce vulnerability to attacks
Information systems shall be hardened by removing unnecessary services and disabling unnecessary ports.

nodes.name: Segregation of Information Services
nodes.description: Segregation of Information Services
To protect information services from interference
Information processing facilities and services shall be segregated based on criticality and sensitivity.

nodes.name: Monitoring Third Party Connections
nodes.description: Monitoring Third Party Connections
To ensure security of connections with third parties
Connections and information exchanges with third parties shall be monitored and controlled.

nodes.name: Installation of Software on User Equipment
nodes.description: Installation of Software on User Equipment
To prevent installation of unauthorized software
Policies shall prohibit the installation of unauthorized software on user equipment.

nodes.name: Patch Management and Updates
nodes.description: Patch Management and Updates
To maintain system security by addressing vulnerabilities
Patches and updates shall be applied to systems in a timely manner following testing and approval.

nodes.name: Disposal of Media
nodes.description: Disposal of Media
To prevent unauthorized access to information before disposal
All items of storage media shall be securely disposed of when no longer required.

nodes.name: Handling of Removable Media
nodes.description: Handling of Removable Media
To prevent unauthorized access to information on removable media
Removable information storage media shall be handled in accordance with the organization's classification scheme.

nodes.name: Electronic Messaging
nodes.description: Electronic Messaging
To ensure secure electronic messaging
Electronic messaging facilities shall be protected to prevent information leakage and maintain data integrity.

nodes.name: Exchange of Sensitive Information
nodes.description: Exchange of Sensitive Information
To prevent unauthorized access to sensitive information during transmission
Policies and procedures shall be developed for the secure exchange of sensitive information.

nodes.name: Network Management
nodes.description: Network Management
To maintain network security and integrity
Network resources shall be managed to optimize availability and performance.

nodes.name: System Monitoring and Performance Tracking
nodes.description: System Monitoring and Performance Tracking
The confidentiality, integrity, and availability of data-in-use are protected
nodes.example: Remove data that must remain confidential (e.g., from processors and memory) as soon as it is no longer needed

nodes.description: To ensure optimal system performance and early detection of anomalies
System performance and activity shall be continuously monitored with alerts configured for anomalous behavior.

nodes.name: Clock Synchronization
nodes.description: Clock Synchronization
To ensure the accuracy of audit logs
The clocks of all relevant information processing systems within an organization or security domain shall be synchronized with an agreed accurate time source.

nodes.name: Fault Logging
nodes.description: Fault Logging
Cybersecurity supply chain risk management plans include provisions for activities that occur after the conclusion of a partnership or service agreement
nodes.example: Establish processes for terminating critical relationships under both normal and adverse circumstances

nodes.description: Supply chain security practices are integrated into cybersecurity and enterprise risk management programs, and their performance is monitored throughout the technology product and service life cycle
nodes.example: Policies and procedures require provenance records for all acquired technology products and services

nodes.description: Planning and due diligence are performed to reduce risks before entering into formal supplier or other third-party relationships
nodes.example: Perform thorough due diligence on prospective suppliers that is consistent with procurement planning and commensurate with the level of risk, criticality, and complexity of each supplier relationship

nodes.description: A cybersecurity supply chain risk management program, strategy, objectives, policies, and processes are established and agreed to by organizational stakeholders
nodes.example: Establish a strategy that expresses the objectives of the cybersecurity supply chain risk management program

nodes.description: Lines of communication across the organization are established for cybersecurity risks, including risks from suppliers and other third parties
nodes.example: Determine how to update senior executives, directors, and management on the organization's cybersecurity posture at agreed-upon intervals

nodes.description: To minimize the impact of information processing incidents and malfunctions
Faults shall be logged, analyzed and appropriate action taken.

nodes.name: Operator Logs
nodes.description: Operator Logs
Adequate resource capacity to ensure availability is maintained
nodes.example: Monitor usage of storage, power, compute, network bandwidth, and other resources

nodes.description: To record events and generate evidence
Operator logs shall be maintained to record activities.

nodes.name: Information Backup
nodes.description: Information Backup
To maintain the integrity and availability of information and information processing facilities
Backup copies of information and software shall be taken and tested regularly in accordance with the agreed backup policy.

nodes.name: Controls Against Mobile Code
nodes.description: Controls Against Mobile Code
To ensure that mobile code is authorized before use
Where the use of mobile code is authorized, the configuration shall ensure that mobile code operates according to a clearly defined security policy.

nodes.name: Protection Against Malicious Code
nodes.description: Protection Against Malicious Code
To protect the integrity of software and information
Detection, prevention and recovery controls to protect against malicious code and appropriate user awareness procedures shall be implemented.

nodes.name: System Acceptance
nodes.description: System Acceptance
To ensure that new information systems meet the organization's requirements
Acceptance criteria for new information systems, upgrades and new versions shall be established and suitable tests of the system carried out prior to acceptance.

nodes.name: Capacity Planning
nodes.description: Capacity Planning
To reduce the risk of system overload
The use of resources shall be monitored and tuned and projections made of future capacity requirements.

nodes.name: Managing Changes to Third Party Services
nodes.description: Managing Changes to Third Party Services
To ensure that changes to the provision of services do not compromise information security
Changes to the provision of services, including maintaining and improving existing information security policies, procedures and controls, shall be managed.

nodes.name: Monitoring and Review of Third Party Services
nodes.description: Monitoring and Review of Third Party Services
To maintain an agreed level of information security and service delivery
The services, reports and records provided by the third party shall be regularly monitored and reviewed.

nodes.name: Service Delivery
nodes.description: Service Delivery
To ensure that security controls, service definitions and delivery levels included in third party service delivery agreement are implemented, operated and maintained
Organizations shall ensure that the security controls, service definitions and delivery levels included in the third party service delivery agreement are implemented, operated and maintained.

nodes.name: Separation of Development and Production Facilities
nodes.description: Separation of Development and Production Facilities
To reduce the risk of unauthorized access or changes to operational systems
Development and production facilities shall be separated to reduce the risks of unauthorized access or changes to the operational system.

nodes.name: Segregation of Duties
nodes.description: Segregation of Duties
To reduce the opportunities for unauthorized or unintentional modification or misuse of the organization's assets
Duties and areas of responsibility shall be segregated to reduce opportunities for unauthorized or unintentional modification or misuse of the organization's assets.

nodes.name: Change Management
nodes.description: Change Management
To prevent system disruptions
Changes to information processing facilities and systems shall be controlled.

nodes.name: Documented Operating Procedures
nodes.description: Documented Operating Procedures
To ensure the correct and secure operation of information processing facilities
Operating procedures shall be documented, maintained and made available to all users who need them.

nodes.name: Physical and Environmental Security
nodes.description: HITRUST CSF Category 8: Physical and Environmental Security

nodes.name: Unattended User Equipment
nodes.description: Unattended User Equipment
Hardware is maintained, replaced, and removed commensurate with risk
nodes.example: Replace hardware when it lacks needed security capabilities or when it cannot support software with needed security capabilities

nodes.description: To prevent unauthorized access to information
Users shall ensure that unattended equipment has appropriate protection.

nodes.name: Security of Equipment Off-Premises
nodes.description: Security of Equipment Off-Premises
To ensure the security of equipment and assets off-premises
Security shall be applied to off-site equipment taking into account the different risks of working outside the organization's premises.

nodes.name: Removal of Property
nodes.description: Removal of Property
To prevent unauthorized removal of assets
Equipment, information or software shall not be taken off-site without prior authorization.

nodes.name: Secure Disposal or Re-use of Equipment
nodes.description: Secure Disposal or Re-use of Equipment
To prevent information leakage
All items of equipment containing storage media shall be checked to ensure that any sensitive data and licensed software has been removed or securely overwritten.

nodes.name: Equipment Maintenance
nodes.description: Equipment Maintenance
To ensure the continuing availability and integrity of information processing facilities
Equipment shall be correctly maintained to ensure its continued availability and integrity.

nodes.name: Cabling Security
nodes.description: Cabling Security
To prevent interception, interference or damage to information services
Power and telecommunications cabling carrying data or supporting information services shall be protected from interception or damage.

nodes.name: Supporting Utilities
nodes.description: Supporting Utilities
To prevent loss or damage to assets and interruption to the organization's activities
Equipment shall be protected from power failures and other disruptions caused by failures in supporting utilities.

nodes.name: Equipment Siting and Protection
nodes.description: Equipment Siting and Protection
To prevent loss, damage, theft or compromise of assets and interruption to the organization's activities
Equipment shall be sited and protected to reduce the risks from environmental threats and hazards.

nodes.name: Public Access, Delivery and Loading Areas
nodes.description: Public Access, Delivery and Loading Areas
To prevent unauthorized access to premises
Access points such as delivery and loading areas and other points where unauthorized persons may enter the premises shall be controlled.

nodes.name: Working in Secure Areas
nodes.description: Working in Secure Areas
To prevent unauthorized physical access, damage and interference to information and information processing facilities
Physical protection and guidelines for working in secure areas shall be designed and applied.

nodes.name: Securing Offices, Rooms and Facilities
nodes.description: Securing Offices, Rooms and Facilities
To prevent loss, damage, theft or compromise of assets and interruption to the organization's activities
Physical security for offices, rooms and facilities shall be designed and applied.

nodes.name: Physical Entry Controls
nodes.description: Physical Entry Controls
To prevent unauthorized physical access to facilities
Secure areas shall be protected by appropriate entry controls to ensure that only authorized personnel are allowed access.

nodes.name: Physical Security Perimeter
nodes.description: Physical Security Perimeter
To prevent unauthorized physical access, damage and interference to the organization's premises and information
Security perimeters shall be used to protect areas that contain information and information processing facilities.

nodes.name: Asset Management
nodes.description: HITRUST CSF Category 7: Asset Management

nodes.name: Information Labeling and Handling
nodes.description: Information Labeling and Handling
To ensure that information receives an appropriate level of protection
An appropriate set of procedures for information labeling and handling shall be developed and implemented.

nodes.name: Classification Guidelines
nodes.description: Classification Guidelines
To ensure that information receives an appropriate level of protection
Information shall be classified in terms of its value, legal requirements, sensitivity and criticality to the organization.

nodes.name: Acceptable Use of Assets
nodes.description: Acceptable Use of Assets
To prevent unauthorized disclosure, modification, removal or destruction of assets
Rules for the acceptable use of information and assets associated with information processing facilities shall be identified, documented and implemented.

nodes.name: Ownership of Assets
nodes.description: Ownership of Assets
To ensure that information receives an appropriate level of protection
All information and assets associated with information processing facilities shall be owned by a designated part of the organization.

nodes.name: Inventory of Assets
nodes.description: Inventory of Assets
Inventories of software, services, and systems managed by the organization are maintained
nodes.example: Maintain inventories for all types of software and services, including commercial-off-the-shelf, open-source, custom applications, API services, and cloud-based applications and services

nodes.description: Inventories of hardware managed by the organization are maintained
nodes.example: Maintain inventories for all types of hardware, including IT, IoT, OT, and mobile devices

nodes.description: To identify organizational assets and define appropriate protection responsibilities
All assets shall be clearly identified and an inventory of all important assets drawn up and maintained.

nodes.name: Compliance
nodes.description: HITRUST CSF Category 6: Compliance

nodes.name: Protection of Information Systems Audit Tools
nodes.description: Protection of Information Systems Audit Tools
To prevent misuse of or compromise to information systems audit tools
Access to information systems audit tools shall be protected to prevent any possible misuse or compromise.

nodes.name: Information Systems Audit Controls
nodes.description: Information Systems Audit Controls
To maximize the effectiveness and minimize interference to/from the information systems audit process
Audit requirements and activities involving checks on operational systems shall be carefully planned and agreed to minimize the risk of disruptions to business processes.

nodes.name: Technical Compliance Checking
nodes.description: Technical Compliance Checking
To ensure that systems are technically compliant with security standards
Information systems shall be regularly checked for compliance with security implementation standards.

nodes.name: Compliance with Security Policies and Standards
nodes.description: Compliance with Security Policies and Standards
Adequate resources are allocated commensurate with the cybersecurity risk strategy, roles, responsibilities, and policies
nodes.example: Conduct periodic management reviews to ensure that those given cybersecurity risk management responsibilities have the necessary authority

nodes.description: A standardized method for calculating, documenting, categorizing, and prioritizing cybersecurity risks is established and communicated
nodes.example: Establish criteria for using a quantitative approach to cybersecurity risk analysis, and specify probability and exposure formulas

nodes.description: Risk management objectives are established and agreed to by organizational stakeholders
nodes.example: Update near-term and long-term cybersecurity risk management objectives as part of annual strategic planning and when major changes occur

nodes.description: To ensure compliance of systems with organizational security policies and standards
Managers shall ensure that all security procedures within their area of responsibility are carried out correctly to achieve compliance with security policies and standards.

nodes.name: Regulation of Cryptographic Controls
nodes.description: Regulation of Cryptographic Controls
To comply with relevant agreements, laws and regulations
Cryptographic controls shall be used in compliance with all relevant agreements, laws and regulations.

nodes.name: Prevention of Misuse of Information Processing Facilities
nodes.description: Prevention of Misuse of Information Processing Facilities
To deter users from using information processing facilities for unauthorized purposes
Users shall be deterred from using information processing facilities for unauthorized purposes.

nodes.name: Data Protection and Privacy of Covered Information
nodes.description: Data Protection and Privacy of Covered Information
To ensure compliance with data protection and privacy legislation and regulations
Data protection and privacy shall be ensured as required by relevant legislation and regulations.

nodes.name: Protection of Organizational Records
nodes.description: Protection of Organizational Records
To protect important records from loss, destruction and falsification
Important records shall be protected from loss, destruction and falsification.

nodes.name: Intellectual Property Rights (IPR)
nodes.description: Intellectual Property Rights (IPR)
To ensure compliance with legal restrictions on the use of material which may be protected by intellectual property rights
Appropriate procedures shall be implemented to ensure compliance with legislative, regulatory and contractual requirements on the use of material in respect of intellectual property rights.

nodes.name: Identification of Applicable Legislation
nodes.description: Identification of Applicable Legislation
To avoid breaches of any law, statutory, regulatory or contractual obligations
All relevant legislative, statutory, regulatory and contractual requirements and the organization's approach to meet these requirements shall be explicitly identified.

nodes.name: Organization of Information Security
nodes.description: HITRUST CSF Category 5: Organization of Information Security

nodes.name: Managing Changes to Third Party Services
nodes.description: Managing Changes to Third Party Services
Individuals in specialized roles are provided with awareness and training so that they possess the knowledge and skills to perform relevant tasks with cybersecurity risks in mind
nodes.example: Identify the specialized roles within the organization that require additional cybersecurity training, such as physical and cybersecurity personnel, finance personnel, senior leadership, and anyone with access to business-critical data

nodes.description: Critical suppliers are assessed prior to acquisition
nodes.example: Conduct supplier risk assessments against business and applicable cybersecurity requirements, including the supply chain

nodes.description: The risks posed by a supplier, their products and services, and other third parties are understood, recorded, prioritized, assessed, responded to, and monitored over the course of the relationship
nodes.example: Adjust assessment formats and frequencies based on the third party's reputation and the criticality of the products or services they provide

nodes.description: Suppliers are known and prioritized by criticality
nodes.example: Develop criteria for supplier criticality based on, for example, the sensitivity of data processed or possessed by suppliers, the degree of access to the organization's systems, and the importance of the products or services to the organization's mission

nodes.description: Cybersecurity supply chain risk management is integrated into cybersecurity and enterprise risk management, risk assessment, and improvement processes
nodes.example: Identify areas of alignment and overlap with cybersecurity and enterprise risk management

nodes.description: Risk appetite and risk tolerance statements are established, communicated, and maintained
nodes.example: Determine and communicate risk appetite statements that convey expectations about the appropriate level of risk for the organization

nodes.description: Internal and external stakeholders are understood, and their needs and expectations regarding cybersecurity risk management are understood and considered
nodes.example: Identify relevant internal stakeholders and their cybersecurity-related expectations (e.g., performance and risk expectations of officers, directors, and advisors; cultural expectations of employees)

nodes.description: To maintain information security and service delivery in line with third party agreements
Changes to the provision of services, including maintaining and improving existing information security policies, procedures and controls, shall be managed.

nodes.name: Information Security Requirements in Contracts
nodes.description: Information Security Requirements in Contracts
To satisfy security requirements in outsourcing contracts

Agreements with third parties involving accessing, processing, communicating or managing the organization's information or information processing facilities shall include requirements to address information security concerns.

nodes.name: Addressing Security when Dealing with Customers
nodes.description: Addressing Security when Dealing with Customers
To protect organizational assets that are accessible by customers
All identified security requirements shall be addressed before giving customers access to the organization's assets or information.

nodes.name: Third Party Service Delivery Management
nodes.description: Third Party Service Delivery Management
To maintain an agreed level of information security and service delivery in line with third party agreements
Organizations shall monitor and review third party services, reports and records produced by the third party organization.

nodes.name: Addressing Security in Third Party Agreements
nodes.description: Addressing Security in Third Party Agreements
Cyber threat intelligence is received from information sharing forums and sources
nodes.example: Configure cybersecurity tools and technologies with detection or response capabilities to securely ingest cyber threat intelligence feeds

nodes.description: To ensure protection of the organization's assets that are accessible by third parties
All identified security requirements shall be addressed before granting third parties access to the organization's assets.

nodes.name: Identification of Risks from Third Party Access
nodes.description: Identification of Risks from Third Party Access
To maintain the security of the organization's information and information processing facilities
Risks to the organization's information and information processing facilities from business processes involving external parties shall be identified.

nodes.name: Information Security in Project Management
nodes.description: Information Security in Project Management
To ensure that information security is designed and implemented within IS projects
Information security shall be addressed in project management.

nodes.name: Contact with Special Interest Groups
nodes.description: Contact with Special Interest Groups
To maintain awareness of best practice and stay up to date with security information
Appropriate contacts with special interest groups or other specialist security forums shall be maintained.

nodes.name: Contact with Authorities
nodes.description: Contact with Authorities
To maintain appropriate contacts with relevant authorities
Appropriate contacts with relevant authorities shall be maintained.

nodes.name: Segregation of Duties
nodes.description: Segregation of Duties
To reduce opportunities for unauthorized modification or misuse of information or services
Conflicting duties and areas of responsibility shall be segregated.

nodes.name: Information Security Roles and Responsibilities
nodes.description: Information Security Roles and Responsibilities
To establish a management framework to initiate and control the implementation and operation of information security
All information security responsibilities shall be defined and allocated.

nodes.name: Security Policy
nodes.description: HITRUST CSF Category 4: Security Policy

nodes.name: Review of Information Security Policy
nodes.description: Review of Information Security Policy
Policy for managing cybersecurity risks is reviewed, updated, communicated, and enforced to reflect changes in requirements, threats, technology, and organizational mission
nodes.example: Update policy based on periodic reviews of cybersecurity risk management results to ensure that policy and supporting processes and procedures adequately maintain risk at an acceptable level

nodes.description: Policy for managing cybersecurity risks is established based on organizational context, cybersecurity strategy, and priorities and is communicated and enforced
nodes.example: Create, disseminate, and maintain an understandable, usable risk management policy with statements of management intent, expectations, and direction

nodes.description: To ensure the information security policy remains suitable, adequate and effective
The information security policy shall be reviewed at planned intervals or if significant changes occur.

nodes.name: Information Security Policy Document
nodes.description: Information Security Policy Document
To provide management direction and support for information security
An information security policy shall be defined, approved by management, published and communicated to all relevant employees and external parties.

nodes.name: Risk Management
nodes.description: HITRUST CSF Category 3: Risk Management

nodes.name: Risk Evaluation
nodes.description: Risk Evaluation
To monitor and review the risk management process
The effectiveness of risk assessments and risk treatment shall be evaluated at planned intervals.

nodes.name: Risk Mitigation
nodes.description: Risk Mitigation
To reduce risks to an acceptable level
Risk mitigation strategies and plans shall be developed and implemented to achieve and maintain an approved level of residual risk.

nodes.name: Performing Risk Assessments
nodes.description: Performing Risk Assessments
To systematically identify, analyze and evaluate information security risks
Risk assessments shall identify, quantify, and prioritize risks against criteria for risk acceptance and objectives relevant to the organization.

nodes.name: Risk Management Program Development
nodes.description: Risk Management Program Development
To ensure risks to the organization's information and information processing facilities are managed
A risk management program shall be developed and maintained that includes processes for risk assessment, risk treatment, risk acceptance and communication of risk.

nodes.name: Human Resources Security
nodes.description: HITRUST CSF Category 2: Human Resources Security

nodes.name: Removal of Access Rights
nodes.description: Removal of Access Rights
To ensure that access rights are removed appropriately upon termination
The access rights of all employees, contractors and third-party users to information and information processing facilities shall be removed upon termination.

nodes.name: Return of Assets
nodes.description: Return of Assets
To ensure that all employees, contractors and third-party users return all organizational assets in their possession
All employees, contractors and third-party users shall return all of the organizational assets in their possession upon termination.

nodes.name: Termination Responsibilities
nodes.description: Termination Responsibilities
To ensure that employees, contractors and third-party users exit the organization or change employment in an orderly manner
Responsibilities for performing employment termination or change of employment shall be clearly defined and assigned.

nodes.name: Disciplinary Process
nodes.description: Disciplinary Process
To address information security breaches effectively and deter future incidents
There shall be a formal disciplinary process for employees who have committed a security breach.

nodes.name: Information Security Awareness, Education, and Training
nodes.description: Information Security Awareness, Education, and Training
To ensure that employees are aware of information security threats and concerns and are equipped to support organizational security policy
All employees and, where relevant, contractors and third-party users shall receive appropriate awareness training.

nodes.name: Management Responsibilities
nodes.description: Management Responsibilities
To ensure that employees, contractors and third-party users are aware of information security threats
Management shall require employees, contractors and third-party users to apply security in accordance with the established policies.

nodes.name: Terms and Conditions of Employment
nodes.description: Terms and Conditions of Employment
To ensure employees, contractors and third-party users are aware of and fulfill their security responsibilities
Employees, contractors and third-party users shall agree and sign the terms and conditions of their employment contract.

nodes.name: Screening
nodes.description: Screening
To verify that candidates for employment are suitable and qualified for their roles
Background verification checks on all candidates for employment, contractors, and third-party users shall be carried out.

nodes.name: Roles and Responsibilities
nodes.description: Roles and Responsibilities
To ensure that employees, contractors and third-party users understand their responsibilities
Security roles and responsibilities of employees, contractors and third-party users shall be defined and documented.

nodes.name: Access Control
nodes.description: HITRUST CSF Category 1: Access Control

nodes.name: Teleworking
nodes.description: Teleworking
To protect information accessed, processed or stored at teleworking sites
Policy, operational plans and procedures shall be developed and implemented for teleworking activities.

nodes.name: Mobile Computing and Communications
nodes.description: Mobile Computing and Communications
To ensure information security when using mobile computing and communication facilities
A formal policy and appropriate security measures shall be adopted to protect against the risks of using mobile computing.

nodes.name: Sensitive System Isolation
nodes.description: Sensitive System Isolation
To reduce opportunity for unauthorized modification, loss or disclosure of sensitive information
Sensitive systems shall have a dedicated (isolated) computing environment.

nodes.name: Limitation of Connection Time
nodes.description: Limitation of Connection Time
To provide additional security for high-risk applications
Restrictions on connection times shall be used to provide additional security for high-risk applications.

nodes.name: Information Access Restriction
nodes.description: Information Access Restriction
To prevent unauthorized access to application information and functions
Access to information and application system functions by users and support personnel shall be restricted in accordance with the defined access control policy.

nodes.name: Session Time-out
nodes.description: Session Time-out
To reduce the risk of unauthorized access to information through unattended sessions
Inactive sessions shall shut down after a defined period of inactivity.

nodes.name: Use of System Utilities
nodes.description: Use of System Utilities
To prevent potential misuse or compromise of systems and information
The use of utility programs that might be capable of overriding system and application controls shall be restricted and tightly controlled.

nodes.name: Password Management System
nodes.description: Password Management System
To ensure system passwords are managed effectively and securely
Systems for managing passwords shall be interactive and shall ensure quality passwords.

nodes.name: User Identification and Authentication
nodes.description: User Identification and Authentication
Identities are proofed and bound to credentials based on the context of interactions
nodes.example: Verify a person's claimed identity at enrollment time using government-issued identity credentials (e.g., passport, visa, driver's license)

nodes.description: To prevent unauthorized user access and compromised user IDs
All users shall have a unique identifier (user ID) for their personal and sole use.

nodes.name: Secure Log-on Procedures
nodes.description: Secure Log-on Procedures
To prevent unauthorized access to information systems
Access to operating systems shall be controlled by a secure log-on procedure.

nodes.name: Network Routing Control
nodes.description: Network Routing Control
Inventories of services provided by suppliers are maintained
nodes.example: Inventory all external services used by the organization, including third-party infrastructure-as-a-service (IaaS), platform-as-a-service (PaaS), and software-as-a-service (SaaS) offerings; APIs; and other externally hosted application services

nodes.description: To ensure security of information in networks and protection of connected services
Routing controls shall be implemented for networks to ensure that computer connections and information flows do not breach the access control policy.

nodes.name: Network Connection Control
nodes.description: Network Connection Control
To prevent unauthorized network connections that could compromise security
For shared networks, especially those extending across the organization's boundaries, the capability of users to connect to the network shall be restricted.

nodes.name: Segregation in Networks
nodes.description: Segregation in Networks
To prevent unauthorized access and protect network services and information
Groups of information services, users, and information systems shall be segregated on networks.

nodes.name: Remote Diagnostic and Configuration Port Protection
nodes.description: Remote Diagnostic and Configuration Port Protection
To prevent unauthorized remote access to information systems and networks
Physical and logical access to diagnostic and configuration ports shall be controlled.

nodes.name: Equipment Identification in Networks
nodes.description: Equipment Identification in Networks
To control network connections and prevent unauthorized access
Automatic equipment identification shall be considered as a means to authenticate connections.

nodes.name: User Authentication for External Connections
nodes.description: User Authentication for External Connections
To prevent unauthorized remote access to information systems
Appropriate authentication methods shall be used to control access by remote users.

nodes.name: Policy on the Use of Network Services
nodes.description: Policy on the Use of Network Services
To ensure user access to network services is properly authorized
A policy shall be established concerning the use of network services.

nodes.name: Clear Desk and Clear Screen Policy
nodes.description: Clear Desk and Clear Screen Policy
To reduce risk of unauthorized access, loss or damage to information during and outside normal working hours
A clear desk policy for papers and removable storage media and a clear screen policy for information processing facilities shall be adopted.

nodes.name: Unattended User Equipment
nodes.description: Unattended User Equipment
To prevent unauthorized access to information through unattended equipment
Users shall ensure that unattended equipment has appropriate protection.

nodes.name: Password Use
nodes.description: Password Use
To maintain security of passwords through proper use by users
Users shall be required to follow good security practices in the selection and use of passwords.

nodes.name: Review of User Access Rights
nodes.description: Review of User Access Rights
To maintain appropriate access rights and prevent accumulation of excessive privileges
Asset owners shall review users' access rights at regular intervals.

nodes.name: User Password Management
nodes.description: User Password Management
To ensure proper password allocation and management prevents unauthorized access
The allocation of passwords shall be controlled through a formal management process.

nodes.name: Privilege Management
nodes.description: Privilege Management
To prevent unauthorized access and compromise of information systems through management of privileged access
The allocation and use of privileges shall be restricted and controlled.

nodes.name: User Registration
nodes.description: User Registration
To ensure that authorized users are provided access to systems and services and unauthorized access is prevented
A formal user registration and de-registration procedure shall be implemented to enable assignment of access rights.

nodes.name: Access Control Policy
nodes.description: Access Control Policy
To control access to information assets and business processes according to business and security needs
An access control policy shall be established, documented, and reviewed based on business and information security requirements.

nodes.name: Information Security Management Program
nodes.description: HITRUST CSF Category 0: Information Security Management Program

nodes.name: Information Security Management Program
nodes.description: Information Security Management Program
Implementing and managing an Information Security Management Program

Establish, implement, maintain and continually improve an information security management program, including necessary policies, procedures, guidelines, and associated resources and controls, managed with a risk-based approach, to manage and protect information assets.
